Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.New-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024 (212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2019-11-26T21:06:52Description is in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
New-York Historical Society
Time Inc. Index Cards
Time, inc.
MS 3009-RG 4
260 Linear feet in 258 record cartons which include 173 reels of microfilm
1933-1993, undated Time Inc. Index Cards span from approximately 1933 to 1993 and contain groups of index cards used by Time Inc. staff for writing, searching, and cross referencing subject terms related to Time Inc.'s major magazines, and as directories for published books and interviews. These materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact manuscripts@nyhistory.org prior to your research visit to coordinate access. Keep in mind that it will take up to (5) business days for collections to arrive, and you should plan your research accordingly.
Provenance
Gift of Time Inc. in 2015.
Related Archival Materials Note
This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.
Use Restrictions
This collection is owned by the New-York Historical Society. Although the N-YHS owns this collection as a physical property, the donor specifically retains all copyright and all other proprietary rights which may exist. The copyright law of the United States governs the making of photocopies and protects unpublished materials as well as published materials. Unpublished materials created before January 1, 1978 cannot be quoted in publication without permission of the copyright holder.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use.
Preferred Citation Note
This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Index Cards, MS 3009-RG 4, New-York Historical Society.
Arrangement Note
Organized into 11 series:
Series I: Discover
Series II:Life
Series III: Life International
Series IV: People
Series V: Sports Illustrated
Series VI: Subject Files
Series VII: Time
Series VIII:Time Advertising Promotion
Series IX: Time Canada
Series X: Time Inc. History Project
Series XI: Time International
Series XII: Time-Life International Advertising Promotion
Series XIII: Unfiled
Processing Information Note
The Time Inc. Index Cards were processed by Samantha Brown in July and August 2016. The cards were removed from filing cabinets and rehoused in archival trays within file boxes. The unfiled index cards were found loose and rehoused in the same manner. Brown created the inventory, and Brown and Holly Deakyne wrote other descriptive notes to produce this finding aid.
Scope and Contents Note
The Time Inc. Index Cards span from approximately 1933 to 1993 and contain groups of index cards used by Time Inc. staff for writing, searching, and cross referencing materials related to Time Inc.'s major magazines, and as directories for published books and interviews. The major publications such as Time, Life, Discover, People, and Sports Illustrated each have a subject index. The majority of index cards provide a subject term, a brief description of a topic, and a date when the topic was covered within the associated magazine. There is also a section of general subjects that is not linked to a specific publication.
Publishers and publishing -- New York (State) -- New York. Card indexes Time, inc. -- Archives
Series I: Discover1621972 Linear feet(2 boxes)1980-1987176-177
Arrangement Note
All materials in this series are arranged in original alphabetical order.
Scope and Contents Note
Discover contains index cards that serve as a subject index for Discover magazine.The index cards provide a subject term, a brief description of a topic, and the date the topic was covered in the magazine. The topics covered include people, places, events, organizations, and objects. Only subjects starting with the letters C through Z are covered in this series.Series II: Life16228119 Linear feet(17 boxes, 168 reels of microfilm)1936-1987
Scope and Contents Note
Life contains index cards and microfilm images of index cards that act as a subject cross-reference to the American version of Life magazine. Each index card contains a subject term, a brief overview of a topic, and a date in which the topic was covered. Topics covered on the index cards include people, places, events, organizations, and objects. Dates on microfilm refer to the original contents and not the date of microfilm creation.
Arrangement Note
The materials in this series are kept in their original order of chronological groups. The original alphabetical arrangement within each group is also maintained.1936-1943C-Z (microfilm)33291944-1951A-Sk (microfilm)3329Sk-ZY (microfilm)33301952-1961Cards162282186A-Ny (microfilm)3330Ny-Z (microfilm)33311962-1972162283AAA Jewelers Messenger Service -- Automobiles162284186Automobiles -- Brabham-Repco162285187Brabourne, Amanda -- Clubs162286188Clubs -- Driving Ranges162287189Driving the Pizza Parties From the Temple -- Funerals162288190Funerals -- Ho Chi Minh162289191Ho Chi Minh -- Kennedy Memorial Library162290192Kennedy Memorial Library -- Lyon, Fred162291193Lyon, Fred -- Movies162292194Movies -- Paintings162293195Paintings -- Rembar, Charles 162294196Rembrandt Van Vijn -- Shoes162295197Shoes -- Tents162296198Tents -- Wayman, Stan162297199Wayman, Stan -- Zygielbaum, Joseph162867200A-Ga (microfilm)3331Ga-Z (microfilm)33321978-1987162622A&M -- Burghley House162817200Burk, Dwight -- O'Neill, Terry162818203O'Neill, Terry -- Zwillinger, Rhonda162819204Series III: Life International1623262.1 Linear feet(2 boxes, 5 reels of microfilm)approximately 1946-1965
Scope and Contents Note
Life International contains index cards that act as a subject cross-reference for the version of Life magazine that was produced for audiences outside of the United States. Index cards within this series contain a subject term, a brief overview of a topic, and a date in which the topic was covered within its respective magazine. While the majority of subseries contain subjects with letters ranging from A through Z, some subseries may be missing alphabetical subject areas. Life en Espanol includes microfilm of index cards. The microfilm does not have dates so it isn't clear if it is a duplication of the physical cards or unique material.
Arrangement Note
The materials in this series are divided into 13 subseries: Life ABC/Car (1959,1964), Life Caribbean (1964), Life Continent (1964), Life DF Mexico (1964), Life English (1959-1965), Life en Espanol (1953-1959), Life Europe (1961-1962), Life Ex-Europe (1964), Life International (1946-1958), Life Mexico (1959, 1964), Life Spanish (1964), and Life Sterling (1964).
Since Life International is compromised of an amalgamation of multiple magazines across a broad geography, the materials are divided into subseries that reflect the multiple international publications that Life published and the specific geographical areas those publications were released in. All the materials are kept in their original order and are in alphabetical order. Arrangement Note
The index cards in this series are kept in their original order of two chronological groups: 1974-1982 and 1983-1987. The original alphabetical arrangement within each group is also maintained.
Scope and Contents Note
People contains index cards with subject terms related to topics covered in People magazine. Each index card contains a subject term, a brief description of a topic, and a date in which the topic was covered in the magazine. Scope and Contents Note
Sports Illustrated contains index cards that act as a cross-reference for subjects covered in Sports Illustrated magazine. Each index card cotains a subject term, a brief description of a topic, and a date in which the topic was covered in the magazine. The topics covered include people, places, events, organizations, and objects.

Scope and Contents Note
The Subject files contain index cards which act as a cross-reference for subject terms. Cards contain the term that a user would search by and then directs the user to the appropriate term under which materials related to that topic are filed. Some cards also include related topics. Topics that are covered include people, places, events, organizations, and objects. One photo was discovered with the materials and is filed alongside the index cards in Box 34.

Scope and Contents Note
Time contains index cards that serve as a directory for subject terms for Time magazine. Each index card contains a subject term, a brief description of a topic related to that term, and the date when the topic was covered in the magazine. The topics covered include people, places, events, organizations, and objects.
Arrangement Note
The cards are kept in original order of six chronological groups: 1936-1943, 1943-1950, 1951-1962, 1963-1967, 1968-1982, and World War II. The materials in the World War II group cover the period of 1939-1942. While the majority of groups contain cards beginning with letters A through Z, not all groups contain subject areas for every letter of the alphabet. Arrangement Note
Materials in this series are arranged in their original alphabetical order.
Scope and Contents Note
Time Advertising Promotion includes index cards which act as a directory for advertising campaigns which took place between 1923 and 1971 in Time magazine. Each index card contains a list of advertisements. Additionally, the cards sometimes include information about the edition the advertisement was in as well as memos, research report numbers, direct mail numbers, and miscellaneous notes.Series IX: Time Canada1608741 Linear feet(1 box)1967122
Arrangement Note
All materials in this series are arranged in their original alphabetical order.
Scope and Contents Note
Time Canada contains index cards that serve as a directory for subject terms. Each index card contains a subject term, a brief description of a topic related to that term, and the date when the topic was covered in the magazine. The topics covered on the index cards include people, places, events, organizations, and objects.Series X: Time Inc. History Project1628543 Linear feet(3 boxes)undated
Scope and Contents Note
Time Inc. History Project contains index cards related to the research Alex Groner and Celia Sugarman completed for their project on the history of Times Inc. As part of their research, Groner and Sugarman created four sets of index cards. The Alumni Directory contains the names of those who worked at Time Inc. prior to 1958. Books by Time contains books that were either written by Time Inc staff or published by Time Inc in or prior to 1958. The Interview Names Index contains index cards with the names of those Groner and Sugarman interviewed as part of their project. These cards contain the person's name, the topics they were being interviewed about, and the date they were interviewed. Individual index cards sometimes contain the record of multiple interviews that were conducted with the same person. The Interview Subjects Index contains cards that act as a subject cross-reference to the Interview Names Index. These index cards contain a subject term, the name of the person who was interviewed, and the date the interview took place.
Arrangement Note
This series is arranged into 4 subseries: Alumni Directory, Books by Time, Interview Name Index, and Interview Subject Index. Each subseries is arranged alphabetically either by last name or subject as per the original order.Subseries I: Alumni Directory162823undated506Subseries II: Books by Time162822undated506Subseries III: Interview Names Index162820undated504-505Subseries IV: Interview Subjects Index162821undated505Series XI: Time International1621988 Linear feet(8 boxes)1973-1989
Arrangement Note
The index cards in this series are kept in their original order of two chronological groups: 1973-1983 and 1983-1989. The original alphabetical arrangement within each group is also maintained.
Scope and Contents Note
Time International contains index cards that serve as a subject cross-reference for Time International publications. Each index card contains a subject term, a brief description of a topic related to that term, and the date when the topic was covered in the magazine.1973-1983162199Aaiun Spanish Sahara -- Economy-Spain162200178Economy-Spain -- Long Night of Martal Law162201179Longo, Luigi -- Schmidt, Helmut162202180Schmidt, Helmut -- 72-Hour Document1622031811983-1989162204A&W Root Beer -- Elizabeth, Queen Mother of Great Britain162205182Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain -- Merrithew, Jim162206183Merrithew, Jim -- Tanks162207184Tanks -- Zylberztein162208185Series XII: Time-Life International Advertising Promotion Index1670091 Linear feet(1 box)approximately 1940-1966242
Arrangement Note
Materials are arranged in their original order of two alphabetical groups.
Scope and Contents Note
Time-Life International Advertising Promotion includes index cards which act as a directory for advertising campaigns. Each index card contains a list of information including summaries of advertising campaigns and the year the campaign took place. Sometimes research report, promotion, and memo numbers were included. Materials are from approximately the mid-1940s through 1966.Series XIII: Unfiled1608761 Linear feet(1 box)1943-1987
Arrangement Note
Unfiled contains index cards that were found loose. Based on the original arrangement and separation of materials, the series has been divided into two groups: 1943-1987 and 1966-1968. Within each group, the index cards have been loosely organized alphabetically by subject.
Scope and Contents Note
Index cards in the Unfiled series contain a subject term, a brief description of a topic, and a date. Materials from 1943 to 1987 only contain subject terms beginning with the letters A through W while materials from 1966 to 1968 contain subject terms beginning with the letters A through Z.1943-19871628651231966-1968160878123
